title: Channels
content:

Channels

 

  • Channels
    • Creating a Business Channel
    • Editing a Business Channel
    • Deleting a Business Channel
      • Field Description
      • Action Buttons

Channels are used to define allocations of inventory for sectors of the business other than a store.

For example, e-commerce orders, and wholesale business, etc.

This screen enables the user to define selling channels to which allocations are made in addition to stores.

This configuration screen is used to create, edit and view business channels. The Channels need to be created prior to creating any virtual locations. Users can view the breakup of inventory (inventory segments) based on the channels.

Admin and Manager users can access this screen.

 

 

Filters:

  • Channel Id

Creating a Business Channel

To create a new channel:

 

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Location Configurations > Channels
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Click Create to view the Channel window.
  4. Enter the Channel Id and Description.
  5. Click Save.

 

Note: All mandatory fields are denoted with *.

 

Editing a Business Channel

To edit a channel:

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Location Configurations > Channels.
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Select the required channel record. Swipe-out the menu on the required record card and select Edit.
  4. In the Channel window, modify the required fields.
  5. Click Save to save the modified channel details.

Edit View

  1. Select the required channel record card. The action buttons are displayed in the footer section.
  2. Click Edit to view the Channel window, modify the required fields.
  3. Click Save to save the modified channel details.

Deleting a Business Channel

To delete a channel:

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Location Configurations > Channel.
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Swipe-out menu on the required record card and select Delete.
  4. A warning message pop-up prompts as, 'You are about to delete a channel which is tied to a related entity, either a virtual location or Allocation Policy Phase Hold Back'.
  5. Click Yes to delete the channel.

Delete

  1. Select the required record card. The footer section with action buttons is displayed.
  2. Select Delete.
  3. A warning message pop-up prompts as, 'You are about to delete a channel which is tied to a related entity, either a virtual location or Allocation Policy Phase Hold Back'.
  4. Click Yes to delete the channel.
Note: The user cannot delete Ecom and Retail channel entities because these are seed data channels.
Field Description

The following are the field descriptions of the attributes available on the screen.

 

Field

Description

Channel Id

The business channel identifier. There are 2 channels defined below:

  • Retail → Retail business channel.
  • Ecom → Ecom business channel.

Description

The description of the business channel.

 

Action Buttons

Following are the action buttons available on the screen.

 

Select All Rows

Selects all the rows of records on the screen.

Export

Exports the list of channel attributes, the file will be downloaded onto your system. View Export for more information.

Create

Opens the Channel window.

Deselect

Clears the selected records.

Edit

Opens the Channel window displaying details of the selected record.

Details

Opens the Channel window displaying details of the selected record.

Delete

Deletes the selected record.
